intro: Erythranthe microphylla, commonly known as the small-leaved flowering plant, is a species native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant features small, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of delicate, pink to purple flowers. It typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. Its botanical characteristics make it a valuable addition to native plant gardens and ecological restoration projects.
